title: quarto_home
text:
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: About
text:
1 + 1

[1] 2



library(echarts4r)
e_common(
    font_family = "Raleway"
)

value <- rnorm(10, 10, 2)
nodes <- data.frame(
  name = sample(LETTERS, 10),
  value = value,
  size = value,
  grp = rep(c("grp1", "grp2"), 5),
  symbol = sample(c("circle", "rect", "triangle"), 10, replace = TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
edges <- data.frame(
  source = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  target = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
e_charts() |> 
  e_graph() |> 
  e_graph_nodes(nodes, name, value, size, grp, symbol) |> 
  e_graph_edges(edges, source, target) |> 
  e_tooltip()

title: ggplot2 demo
text:
Figure 1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess"
)





Figure 1: Temperature and ozone level.






Code
library(echarts4r)
e_common(
    font_family = "Raleway"
)
value <- rnorm(10, 10, 2)

nodes <- data.frame(
  name = sample(LETTERS, 10),
  value = value,
  size = value,
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

edges <- data.frame(
  source = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  target = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

e_charts() |> 
  e_graph() |> 
  e_graph_nodes(nodes, name, value, size) |> 
  e_graph_edges(edges, source, target) |> 
  e_tooltip()

title: quarto_home
text:
Air Quality
@fig-airquality further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.
```{r} #| label: fig-airquality #| fig-cap: Temperature and ozone level. #| warning: false
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “loess” ) ```

library(echarts4r)
e_common(
    font_family = "Raleway"
)

value <- rnorm(10, 10, 2)
nodes <- data.frame(
  name = sample(LETTERS, 10),
  value = value,
  size = value,
  grp = rep(c("grp1", "grp2"), 5),
  symbol = sample(c("circle", "rect", "triangle"), 10, replace = TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
edges <- data.frame(
  source = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  target = sample(nodes$name, 20, replace = TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
e_charts() |> 
  e_graph() |> 
  e_graph_nodes(nodes, name, value, size, grp, symbol) |> 
  e_graph_edges(edges, source, target) |> 
  e_tooltip()

title: Map
text:
library(echarts4r)
e_common(
    font_family = "Raleway"
)

quakes |> 
  e_charts(long) |> 
  e_geo(
    roam = TRUE,
    boundingCoords = list(
      c(185, - 10),
      c(165, -40)
     )
  ) |> 
  e_scatter_gl(lat, depth) |> 
  e_visual_map()
